author: Special Correspondent
text:
The Madras High Court on Monday ordered notice to the Directorate of Vigilance and Anti Corruption (DVAC) on a plea by suspended senior IPS officer M.S. Jaffar Sait, who sought to quash the proceedings pending against him over allotment of a Tamil Nadu Housing Board (TNHB) plot in his wife’s name in Tiruvanmiyur.

Mr. Sait submitted that the DVAC had registered a case against him and his family members among others under the Prevention of Corruption Act, 1988 and the Indian Penal Code, following which he was placed under suspension. The case was registered allegedly on a complaint filed by a former employee of the DVAC.

Contending that he had no role in the allotment of the house, the petitioner submitted that in fact his daughter had suffered monetary loss as the TNHB deducted Rs. 14 lakh when she filed a cancellation deed for a plot allotted in her name. The subsequent allotment was made in his wife’s name, for which full payment was made, he claimed. “The complainant had no locus standi to lodge any criminal complaint with regard to the allotment of the housing plot by the TNHB, which had been done after scrupulously following the due process,” the petitioner submitted.
